basics.name: Jonas Meyer-Ohle
basics.label: Model Risk Data Scientist / Engineer @NatWest
basics.summary: Software engineer interested in data science, building data pipelines and visualization tools.

work.name: reverse.supply
highlights: Enhanced technology scalability through close collaboration with founding partners and CTO
Transitioned to serverless architecture by implementing AWS Lambda functions for front-end and back-end segregation
Streamlined ETL processes using Cloudformation and Terraform templates for AWS stack deployment
Developed HTTP and REST APIs for versatile internal and external company use cases
Optimized company warehouse operations via Docker containerization for pricing and grading tools
Crafted insightful dashboards using Amazon Quicksight, integrating data sources like Loki, Cloudwatch, and Athena
Ensured seamless testing and deployment through CI/CD tools, specifically Github Actions

work.name: Charité – Universitätsmedizin Berlin
highlights: Contributed to multiple research projects focused on gait analysis in Parkinson's patients
Enhanced existing codebase for accelerated data processing stages
Developed batch processing pipelines in Python and MATLAB for seamless analysis of recorded measurements
Designed sensor-fusion based algorithms in Python to segment gait phases and detect abnormalities
Provided tutoring and documentation for new scientists to utilize research group's post-measurement pipelines
Actively participated in measurements to prevent potential data issues

work.name: Kozo Keikaku Engineering, Inc.
highlights: Automated antenna design modeling in Finite Element Analysis Software (FEAS)
Streamlined electric-field data transfers between FEAS and visualization tools
Executed extensive field simulations, including company bridge designs

publications.name: Real-Time Detection of Freezing Motions in Parkinson's Patients for Adaptive Gait Phase Synchronous Cueing
